name: General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
description: EU regulation on data protection and privacy for individuals within the EU and EEA

keyArticles.Article 13: Information to be provided where personal data are collected from the data subject
keyArticles.Article 14: Information to be provided where personal data have not been obtained from the data subject
keyArticles.Article 15: Right of access by the data subject
keyArticles.Article 17: Right to erasure (right to be forgotten)

requirements: Identity and contact details of the controller
Contact details of the data protection officer (where applicable)
Purposes of the processing
Legal basis for the processing (Article 6)
Legitimate interests pursued by controller or third party (if applicable)
Recipients or categories of recipients of the personal data
Details of transfers to third country and safeguards
Retention period or criteria used to determine the period
Right to access personal data (Article 15)
Right to rectification (Article 16)
Right to erasure/right to be forgotten (Article 17)
Right to restriction of processing (Article 18)
Right to data portability (Article 20)
Right to object to processing (Article 21)
Right to withdraw consent at any time (where applicable)
Right to lodge a complaint with supervisory authority
Whether provision of personal data is statutory, contractual requirement, or necessary to enter contract
Consequences of failure to provide personal data
Existence of automated decision-making including profiling (Article 22)
Meaningful information about the logic involved in automated processing
Significance and envisaged consequences of automated processing
Information about further processing for different purpose
Source of personal data (Article 14 - if not obtained from data subject)
Categories of personal data concerned (Article 14)
Protection measures for special categories of data (Article 9)
Data minimization principle compliance
Purpose limitation principle compliance
Accuracy principle compliance
Storage limitation principle compliance
Integrity and confidentiality principle (security)
Accountability principle (Article 5(2))
dataSubjectRights: Rights related to automated decision making and profiling
mandatoryElements: Right to lodge complaint with supervisory authority

specialConsiderations.children: Specific consent requirements for children under 16 (Article 8)
specialConsiderations.sensitiveData: Special categories require explicit consent or legal exception (Article 9)
specialConsiderations.breaches: Notification to supervisory authority within 72 hours (Article 33)
